nodes.eligible_entities: Medicaid providers; Primary care physicians; Pediatricians; Dentists; Federally qualified health centers (FQHCs); Rural health centers; Hospitals accepting Medicaid patients; Nurse practitioners; Physician assistants; Behavioral health providers; Substance abuse treatment centers; Mental health providers; Indian tribes and tribal organizations
nodes.program_evolution: Annual state audits of participating providers; Validation of meaningful use claims; Verification of ONC certification; Beneficiary complaint investigation; Financial audit of incentive payments; System capability verification; Privacy and security compliance; Periodic on-site inspections

nodes.documentation_requirements: Stage 1 (2011-2012): Basic EHR capabilities; Stage 2 (2013-2014): Advanced clinical features; Stage 3 (2015-2016): Interoperability and information exchange; Stage 4 (2017+): Continuous improvement
nodes.timeline_start: 500 per provider; Maximum aggregate payment varies by provider type and years of participation; Hospital bonuses: $2
nodes.participation_requirements: Adopt certified EHR technology; Demonstrate meaningful use of EHR; Meet EHR certification standards from Office of the National Coordinator (ONC); Establish EHR governance structure; Implement data security and privacy safeguards; Participate in Medicare quality reporting programs; Meet clinical quality measures
nodes.description: Federal incentive payment program providing financial rewards to eligible healthcare providers who adopt and meaningfully use certified electronic health record (EHR) technology to improve quality; safety; and efficiency of healthcare delivery; reduce health disparities; engage patients in their care; and improve care coordination.
nodes.meaningful_use_requirement: 000 per physician (2011); Declining percentages in subsequent years
nodes.payment_phases: Patient medical records management; Electronic prescribing; Drug interaction checking; Lab result viewing and integration; Secure electronic messaging; Audit logs and access controls; Data encryption; Interoperability and health information exchange capabilities; Clinical decision support; Computerized provider order entry (CPOE)
nodes.phase_3_timeline: Bidirectional exchange of health data; Interoperability with other EHR systems; Standards-based health information exchange; Secure transmission of health records; Public health reporting capability; Syndication of clinical data; Support for transitions of care; Coordination of care across providers
nodes.related_programs: Annual CMS audits of 10-25% of providers; Validation of meaningful use claims; Verification of EHR certification; Clinical measure accuracy verification; Privacy and security compliance assessment; Physical security inspection; Access control testing
nodes.regulatory_basis: HITECH Section 4101; HITECH Section 4201; 42 CFR Part 412 (Hospital Payments); 42 CFR Part 414 (Physician Payments); Medicare Payment Advisory Commission (MedPAC) guidelines
nodes.phase_1_timeline: Use of CPOE for medication orders; Electronic transmission of pharmacist recommendations; Maintenance of medication allergy lists; Recording vital signs and BMI; Recording smoking status; Implement one clinical quality measure set; Patient portal access; Patient engagement tools; Document and communicate with patients electronically
nodes.priority_level: Targeted audits based on risk assessment; Random audit sampling; Complaint-driven investigations; Benchmark comparisons with peer organizations; Data anomaly detection; Workflow observation; Staff interviews; Patient chart audits (100 random charts)
nodes.certified_ehr_requirement: Annual bonus payments; Fixed amount by provider type; Declining payments over 5-year implementation period; Bonuses reduced 25% each year after peak payment; Penalties begin 2015 for non-participants
nodes.administrative_objectives: Yes - all four meaningful use stages required
nodes.interoperability_objectives: Yes - ONC-certified EHR technology required; Updated certification standards each year
nodes.timeline_end: 000 per hospital bed (up to $2 million); Physician incentives: $44
nodes.failure_consequences: Medicare claim forms showing incentive payment eligibility; EHR attestation forms; Meaningful use compliance documentation; Clinical quality measure data; System uptime logs; Security risk assessments; Privacy impact assessments; Staff training records; Backup and disaster recovery test results
nodes.phase_2_timeline: Maintain EHR system uptime (95%+); Accurate patient identification; Complete and legible records; Timely documentation; Training of clinical staff; Privacy and security monitoring; Regular system backup and disaster recovery; Cybersecurity incident response plan
nodes.status: Adoption rate of certified EHR; Meaningful use achievement rate; Quality measure improvement; Patient satisfaction scores; Reduced medical errors; Decreased hospital readmissions; Improved medication adherence; Increased patient portal adoption; Health information exchange volume; Interoperability test success
nodes.eligible_entities: Hospitals; Critical access hospitals (CAHs); Medicare-eligible physicians; Specialists; Psychiatrists; Federally qualified health centers (FQHCs); Rural health centers; Dialysis facilities; Rehabilitation providers
nodes.program_evolution: Annual meaningful use reporting to CMS; Submission of clinical quality measures; EHR system audit logs; Privacy and security incident reports; Interoperability test results; Patient engagement metrics; Care coordination documentation

nodes.name: Privacy and Security Provisions (Enforcement)
nodes.description: Enforcement mechanisms tiered civil monetary penalties enhanced OCR authority business associate direct liability breach notification requirements and safe harbor provisions.
nodes.key_concepts: Tiered penalty framework (4 tiers); Enhanced OCR enforcement authority; Business associate direct liability; Breach notification requirements; Safe Harbor Amendment (2021) provisions; Criminal liability
